name: alsfrsr
description: presence of a record of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis functional rating scale - revised [ALSFRS-R]

valueRange.1: presence

concept.display: Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis functional rating scale - revised [ALSFRS-R]

name: alsfrsrQ1Speech
description: revised ALS functional rating scale - speech

valueRange.1: Speech combined with nonvocal communication
valueRange.2: Intelligible with repeating
valueRange.3: Detectable speech disturbance
valueRange.4: Normal speech processes

name: alsfrsrQ2Salivation
description: revised ALS functional rating scale - salivation

valueRange.0: Marked drooling, requires constant tissue or handkerchief
valueRange.1: Marked excess of saliva with some drooling
valueRange.2: Moderately excessive saliva; may have minimal drooling
valueRange.3: Slight but definite excess of saliva in mouth; may have nighttime drooling
valueRange.4: Normal

name: alsfrsrQ3Swallowing
description: revised ALS functional rating scale - swallowing

valueRange.1: Needs supplemental tube feeding
valueRange.2: Dietary consistency changes
valueRange.3: Early eating problems - occasional choking
valueRange.4: Normal eating habits

name: alsfrsrQ4Handwriting
description: revised ALS functional rating scale - handwriting

valueRange.1: Able to grip pen but unable to write
valueRange.2: Not all words are legible
valueRange.3: Slow or sloppy, all words are legible
valueRange.4: Normal

name: alsfrsrQ5CuttingWo
description: revised ALS functional rating scale - cutting food and handling utensils (patients without gastronomy)

valueRange.1: Food must be cut by someone, but can still feed slowly
valueRange.2: Can cut most foods, although clumsy and slow; some help needed
valueRange.3: Somewhat slow and clumsy, but no help needed
valueRange.4: Normal

concept.display: Cutting food and handling utensils (patients without gastrostomy) [ALSFRS-R]

name: alsfrsrQ5CuttingW
description: revised ALS functional rating scale - cutting food and handling utensils (patients with gastronomy)

valueRange.0: Unable to perform any aspect of task
valueRange.1: Provides minimal assistance to caregiver
valueRange.2: Some help needed with closures and fasteners
valueRange.3: Clumsy but able to perform all manipulations independently
valueRange.4: Normal

concept.display: Cutting food and handling utensils (patients with gastrostomy) [ALSFRS-R]

name: alsfrsrQ6Dressing
description: revised ALS functional rating scale - dressing and hygiene

valueRange.1: Needs attendant for self-care
valueRange.2: Intermittent assistance or substitute methods
valueRange.3: Independent and complete self-care with effort or decreased efficiency
valueRange.4: Normal function

name: alsfrsrQ7Turning
description: revised ALS functional rating scale - turning in bed and adjusting bed clothes

valueRange.1: Can initiate, but not turn or adjust sheets alone
valueRange.2: Can turn alone or adjust sheets, but with great difficulty
valueRange.3: Somewhat slow and clumsy, but no help needed
valueRange.4: Normal

concept.display: Turning in bed and adjusting bed clothes [ALSFRS-R]

name: alsfrsrQ8Walking
description: revised ALS functional rating scale - walking

valueRange.1: Nonambulatory functional movement
valueRange.2: Walks with assistance
valueRange.3: Early ambulation difficulties
valueRange.4: Normal

name: alsfrsrQ9Climbing
description: revised ALS functional rating scale - climbing stairs

valueRange.1: Nonambulatory functional movement
valueRange.2: Walks with assistance
valueRange.3: Early ambulation difficulties
valueRange.4: Normal

name: alsfrsrQ10Dyspnea
description: revised ALS functional rating scale - dyspnea

valueRange.0: Significant difficulty, considering using mechanical respiratory support
valueRange.1: Occurs at rest, difficulty breathing when either sitting or lying
valueRange.2: Occurs with one or more of the following: eating, bathing, dressing (ADL)
valueRange.3: Occurs when walking
valueRange.4: None

name: alsfrsrQ10Dyspnea
description: revised ALS functional rating scale - dyspnea

valueRange.0: Significant difficulty, considering using mechanical respiratory support
valueRange.1: Occurs at rest, difficulty breathing when either sitting or lying
valueRange.2: Occurs with one or more of the following: eating, bathing, dressing (ADL)
valueRange.3: Occurs when walking
valueRange.4: None

name: alsfrsrQ11Orthopnea
description: revised ALS functional rating scale - orthopnea

valueRange.1: Can only sleep sitting up
valueRange.2: Needs extra pillows in order to sleep (more than two)
valueRange.3: Some difficulty sleeping at night due to shortness of breath, does not routinely use more than two pillows
valueRange.4: None

name: alsfrsrQ12Respiratory
description: revised ALS functional rating scale - respiratory insufficiency

valueRange.0: Invasive mechanical ventilation by intubation or tracheostomy
valueRange.1: Continuous use of BiPAP during the night and day
valueRange.2: Continuous use of BiPAP during the night
valueRange.3: Intermittent use of BiPAP
valueRange.4: None

name: alsfrsrRespType
description: revised ALS functional rating scale - respondent type

name: alsfrsrTotal
description: revised ALS functional rating scale - total score

name: ForcedVitalCapacityResltVal
description: Value of the Forced Vital Capacity (FVC), in liters, as the maximum volume of air that can be exhaled as rapidly, forcefully, and completely as possible from the point of maximal inhalation

concept.display: forced vital capacity [volume] measured by spirometry

name: SlowVitalCapPcntPredctdNormVal
description: percentage of the predicted normal value of Slow Vital Capacity (sVC) to grade the severity of the abnormality

name: fvcPercent
description: forced vital capacity (percent of predicted normal value)

name: svcPercent
description: slow vital capacity (percent of predicted normal value)

valueRange.1: presence

name: ManualMuscleTestScoreSABDLeft
description: Manual Muscle Testing (MMT) for left shoulder abduction

valueRange.1: A flicker of movement is seen or felt in the muscle
valueRange.2: Muscle moves the joint when gravity is eliminated
valueRange.3-: Muscle moves the joint against gravity, but not through full mechanical range of motion
valueRange.3: Muscle cannot hold the joint against resistance, but moves the joint fully against gravity
valueRange.3+: Muscle moves the joint fully against gravity and is capable of transient resistance, but collapses abruptly
valueRange.4-: Same as grade 4, but muscle holds the joint only again minimal resistance
valueRange.4: Muscle holds the joint against a combination of gravity and moderate resistance
valueRange.4+: Same as grade 4, but muscle holds the joint against moderate to maximal resistance

concept.display: Shoulder - left Abduction Active Range of Motion Quantitative

description: Manual Muscle Testing (MMT) for right ankle dorsiflexion

valueRange.1: A flicker of movement is seen or felt in the muscle
valueRange.2: Muscle moves the joint when gravity is eliminated
valueRange.3-: Muscle moves the joint against gravity, but not through full mechanical range of motion
valueRange.3: Muscle cannot hold the joint against resistance, but moves the joint fully against gravity
valueRange.3+: Muscle moves the joint fully against gravity and is capable of transient resistance, but collapses abruptly
valueRange.4-: Same as grade 4, but muscle holds the joint only again minimal resistance
valueRange.4: Muscle holds the joint against a combination of gravity and moderate resistance
valueRange.4+: Same as grade 4, but muscle holds the joint against moderate to maximal resistance

valueRange.3+: Muscle moves the joint fully against gravity and is capable of transient resistance, but collapses abruptly
valueRange.4-: Same as grade 4, but muscle holds the joint only again minimal resistance
valueRange.4: Muscle holds the joint against a combination of gravity and moderate resistance
valueRange.4+: Same as grade 4, but muscle holds the joint against moderate to maximal resistance
